snippet: In New York City, hundreds of public housing units have sat unoccupied year after year awaiting major renovations or a decision about their fate.
abstract: New York City Housing Authority auditors find hundreds of public housing units have sat unoccupied year after year awaiting major renovations or decision about their fate; authority plays key role in preserving affordable housing in city, with nearly 179,000 apartments in its control; funding issues and empty units poses test for Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio, who has promised to increase city's affordable housing stock.
lead_paragraph: In New York City, hundreds of public housing units have sat unoccupied year after year awaiting major renovations or a decision about their fate.

headline.main: In Public Housing, Units Languish in Limbo
headline.print_headline: In Public Housing, Units Languish in Limbo
